alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 1:14AM MDT until May 12 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Flood Stage. The river is bankfull. Homeless encampments along creek are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM MDT Friday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 11.7 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.7 feet on 04/30/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM MDT.
